summary.intent: Fix a bug where users couldn't delete failed remediations, getting stuck with a 409 conflict error when trying to start a new remediation. The UI needed to handle the 'failed' status and provide a 'Delete & Retry' button.
summary.outcome: Successfully implemented a three-part fix in RemediateTab.tsx: (1) added 'failed' status handling in loadExistingRemediation to set remediationId and executeError, (2) added a 'Delete & Retry' button in the config phase error display, and (3) added 409 error handling to fetch the blocking remediation ID. All tests, lint, and typecheck passed.

repo: The frontend uses tabs for indentation in RemediateTab.tsx, not spaces
Biome formatter prefers collapsed single-line expressions over multi-line when possible
The remediation state machine has three phases (config, results, running) and the 'failed' status was previously unhandled, causing users to get stuck in config phase
The backend DELETE endpoint already handles failed remediations correctly - only blocks queued/running deletions

code.finding: loadExistingRemediation effect only handled 'completed' and 'running'/'queued' statuses - 'failed' fell through silently without setting remediationId, making deletion impossible
Config phase error display was plain text - needed flex container with conditional 'Delete & Retry' button that reuses existing handleDeleteRemediation handler
409 conflict error in handleExecute needed to fetch the blocking remediation ID via api.getRemediationForEvaluation() to enable deletion button

workflow: Edit tool requires exact whitespace matching including tabs vs spaces
When Biome reports formatting issues, fix them immediately to keep lint passing
Running tests, lint, and typecheck together provides comprehensive validation

friction: Multiple Edit attempts failed due to whitespace/tab mismatches - had to inspect raw bytes with cat -A and od commands to identify tabs
Biome formatter wanted collapsed single-line expressions after initial edits, requiring two additional Edit calls
